moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4 exf4 3. Nf3 g5 4. h4 g4 5: The Rice Gambit, as played by Rice himself.
moves.11... Ng4 12. Nd2 Qxh4 13. Nf3: As long as the black King stays where it is, White can take the Bishop at any time. So White improves his position rather than rushing into a recapture.
moves.13... Qh6 14. Qa4+ c6: A mistake. Now White can drop his Queen onto a diagonal that prevents Black from castling.
moves.15... Nf2 16. Rxe5+: White recaptures his piece without losing a tempo.
moves.16... Be6 17. Kf1 Qh1+ 18. Ng1 Nh3: A dubious sacrifice. Black loses a powerfully posted attacking piece to free a file for his Pawn.
moves.19. gxh3 f3 20. Bg5: With four pieces to one involved, White's attack is more potent than Black's.
With this move, ceding the initiative, Black seals his fate.
moves.24. dxe6+: The final attack begins... and is conducted brilliantly.
